item.title: Reading
item.description: What is Git? Repositories and Commits Remote Repositories Branches Merging in Git

item.title: Exercises: Git
item.description: We will use our new terminal powers to move through the Git exercises. In whichever directory you are keeping your coursework outside of javascript-projects, make a new directory called Git-Exercises using the mkdir command. You want to make sure this is outside of javascript-projects because it will cause an issue if you try and make a new Git repository inside an existing one. Check your solution My-Computer:my-coursework myusername$ mkdir Git-Exercises Inside the Git-Exercises directory, initialize a new Git repository using git init.

item.title: Next Steps
item.description: You are now ready to tackle the DOM. Before moving on to the next chapter, if you would like additional resources on Git, here are a few of our favorites. Linux Basics Git Commands Documentation
